sect1.sect2:
Introdução a Xwayland
The Xwayland package is an Xorg server running on top of the wayland server. It has been separated from the main Xorg server package. It allows running X clients inside a wayland session.

sect2.title: Instalação de Xwayland
sect2.para: Instale xwayland executando os seguintes comandos:

screen.userinput:
sed -i '/install_man/,$d' meson.build &&
mkdir build && cd build &&
meson --prefix=$XORG_PREFIX \ --buildtype=release \ -Dxkb_output_dir=/var/lib/xkb \ .. && ninja

sect2.para: Building the test framework needs some work. First, weston brings in several dependencies, but the number can be reduced by disabling unneeded features. The meson command for a stripped down build of weston is shown in Upstream continuous integration build.
Running the tests involves downloading two other frameworks, in addition to the mentioned optional dependencies:

screen.userinput:
mkdir tools && pushd tools &&
git clone https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/mesa/piglit.git --depth 1 && cat > piglit/piglit.conf << EOF && [xts] path=$(pwd)/xts EOF
git clone https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/test/xts --depth 1 &&
export DISPLAY=:22 && ../hw/vfb/Xvfb $DISPLAY & VFB_PID=$! && cd xts && CFLAGS=-fcommon ./autogen.sh && make && kill $VFB_PID && unset DISPLAY VFB_PID && popd

sect2.para: Then the tests can be run with:

screen.userinput: ninja install && cat >> /etc/sysconfig/createfiles << "EOF" /tmp/.X11-unix dir 1777 root root EOF

sect2.title: Explicações do Comando
sect2.para: sed -i '/install_man/,$d' meson.build: Prevents installing a manual page for Xserver, which is also provided by . Remove this command if is not installed and you don't plan to install it later.

cat >> /etc/sysconfig/createfiles...: This command creates the /tmp/.X11-unix directory at startup, and ensures that the permissions and ownership are correct as required by applications using Xwayland.
